snippet: Speaker John A. Boehner has privately told Republican lawmakers anxious about fallout from the government shutdown that he would not allow a potentially more crippling federal default.
abstract: Speaker John A Boehner privately tells Republican lawmakers anxious about fallout from the government shutdown that he will not allow a potentially more crippling federal default as atmosphere on Capitol Hill turns increasingly tense; says he will use combination of Republican and Democratic votes to increase federal debt limit if necessary.

byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and ANNIE LOWREY
byline.contributor: Jackie Calmes and Jonathan Weisman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Speaker John A. Boehner has privately told Republican lawmakers anxious about fallout from the government shutdown that he would not allow a potentially more crippling federal default.

headline.main: Boehner Pledges to Avoid Default, Republicans Say
headline.print_headline: Boehner Pledges to Avoid Default, Republicans Say
